meanings.sent1: I picked some juicy poms from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The grocery store sells fresh poms in the produce section.
meanings.sent3: The colorful poms looked like little ornaments on the tree.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a basket of poms.
meanings.sent5: The sweet aroma of the poms filled the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The poms are known for their fluffy coats.
meanings.sent2: She loves walking her poms in the park every morning.
meanings.sent3: The poms wagged their tails happily as they played fetch.
meanings.sent4: Her poms were like little balls of fur bouncing around.
meanings.sent5: The poms' barks echoed through the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: She waved her colorful poms during the cheer routine.
meanings.sent2: The cheerleaders twirled their poms in perfect unison.
meanings.sent3: The poms added a fun pop of color to the cheerleader's outfit.
meanings.sent4: Her poms sparkled under the stadium lights.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the poms swishing filled the gymnasium.

meanings.definition: A slang term for British people
meanings.sent1: The tourists were excited to meet the friendly poms.
meanings.sent2: She heard that poms have a great sense of humor.
meanings.sent3: The poms at the pub were cheering for their favorite team.
meanings.sent4: The group of poms stood out with their charming accents.
meanings.sent5: The poms' tea party was the talk of the town.
